statement: E. Arenatime limit per test3 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputThere are $$$n$$$ heroes fighting in the arena. Initially, the $$$i$$$-th hero has $$$a_i$$$ health points.The fight in the arena takes place in several rounds. At the beginning of each round, each alive hero deals $$$1$$$ damage to all other heroes. Hits of all heroes occur simultaneously. Heroes whose health is less than $$$1$$$ at the end of the round are considered killed.If exactly $$$1$$$ hero remains alive after a certain round, then he is declared the winner. Otherwise, there is no winner.Your task is to calculate the number of ways to choose the initial health points for each hero $$$a_i$$$, where $$$1 \\le a_i \\le x$$$, so that there is no winner of the fight. The number of ways can be very large, so print it modulo $$$998244353$$$. Two ways are considered different if at least one hero has a different amount of health. For example, $$$[1, 2, 1]$$$ and $$$[2, 1, 1]$$$ are different.InputThe only line contains two integers $$$n$$$ and $$$x$$$ ($$$2 \\le n \\le 500; 1 \\le x \\le 500$$$).OutputPrint one integer — the number of ways to choose the initial health points for each hero $$$a_i$$$, where $$$1 \\le a_i \\le x$$$, so that there is no winner of the fight, taken modulo $$$998244353$$$.ExamplesInput2 5Output5Input3 3Output15Input5 4Output1024Input13 37Output976890680

There are $n$ heroes fighting. Each hero starts with a certain amount of health points, $a_i$, where $1 \le a_i \le x$.  

In each round, each living hero deals 1 damage to every other hero simultaneously.  A hero with less than 1 health point at the end of a round is eliminated.

If exactly one hero is alive after a round, they win. Otherwise, there is no winner.

What is the number of ways to choose the starting health points for each hero so that there is never a winner?  The answer can be very large, so print it modulo 998244353. Two ways are different if at least one hero has a different starting health point.

You have a group of people. Each person starts with a certain amount of health. Every round, each person deals 1 damage to everyone else. If someone's health drops to 0 or below, they are out. The goal is to find how many different starting health amounts you can give each person so that the game never ends with just one person remaining.
